metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2047 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ssl_verify_server_cert function in sql-common/client.c in MariaDB before 5.5.47, 10.0.x before 10.0.23, and 10.1.x before 10.1.10; Oracle MySQL 5.5.48 and earlier, 5.6.29 and earlier, and 5.7.11 and earlier; and Percona Server do not properly verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via a "/CN=" string in a field in a certificate, as demonstrated by "/OU=/CN=bar.com/CN=foo.com."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbd18 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-common - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.23-1
mariadb-server - 10.0.23-1

No subscription required

No subscription required

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.0.23-1').
mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.12-0ubuntu1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
